reviews.review_msg: Chris is one of the best profs for cmns! His lectures can be quite dry at times but his personality is silly lol. Graded by three easy assignments, quizzes that are simple (just re read slides), and writing exercises in person at the end of class. 10/10 recommend :D

Chris is a great professor who really cares about his students. He seemed very knowledgeable about what he taught and explained his concepts in lecture really well. For the quizzez, if you attend the lecture he usually hinted at what would come, and usually it would be there on the quiz.

He is such a great prof! It's clear he is passionate and wants his students to learn. He is willing to answer any and all questions and teaches the material in a fun way. I actually enjoyed the lectures even though the material can be dry.
Amazing prof. Very supportive and genuinely cares about his student's success.

Chris was one of the best professors I have had at SFU. CMNS 201 was my first Q class and I was very nervous, but Chris explained everything in a way that made total sense. He is very empathetic towards his students, and this was especially prevalent during the COVID-19 crisis, as he constantly gave us many opportunities to earn extra grades!!
